author: Special Correspondent
text:
Namperumal's chariot passing through Uthirai Street at Srirangam as part of the 'Thai Ther' festival on Saturday.— PHOTO: M. SRINATH

A large number of devotees witnessed the ‘Thai car festival’ at Srirangam Sri Ranganathaswamy temple on Saturday.

The 11-day annual festival commenced on January 15 and the car festival marks the ninth day celebrations.

Devotees offered worship to processional idols of Namperumal and Sri Ubaya Nachiars amidst religious fervour. Devotees pulled the temple car through the Uthirai Streets.

Special arrangements were made for the smooth conduct of the festival.
title: Huge turnout for car festival
